holidays.name: Coming Out Day
holidays.description: A day to support and celebrate the LGBTQ+ community by encouraging individuals to 'come out' and live openly and authentically.
holidays.origin: Started in 1988 to commemorate the 1987 National March on Washington for Lesbian and Gay Rights.
holidays.funFact: The original goal was to make coming out more commonplace, and today it‚Äôs one of the most recognized LGBTQ+ awareness days worldwide.

holidays.name: National Sausage Pizza Day
holidays.description: A delicious celebration dedicated to one of the most popular pizza toppings: sausage! Whether spicy or mild, it‚Äôs the perfect excuse to order a sausage pizza.
holidays.origin: An unofficial food holiday created by pizza lovers honoring sausage as a beloved topping.
holidays.funFact: Sausage has been a pizza topping favorite since Italian immigrants brought their recipes to America in the early 1900s.

holidays.name: International Day of the Girl Child
holidays.description: A day to highlight and address the needs and challenges girls face globally, while promoting girls‚Äô empowerment and the fulfillment of their human rights.
holidays.origin: Established by the United Nations in 2011 to emphasize girls' rights and gender equality.
holidays.funFact: The day aims to support more opportunities in education, health, and protection against discrimination for girls worldwide.

holidays.name: M&M‚Äôs Day
holidays.description: A playful celebration of the colorful candy-coated chocolates known and loved by millions around the world.
holidays.origin: Marks the introduction of M&M‚Äôs by Forrest Mars in 1941 during World War II to provide soldiers with heat-resistant chocolate.
holidays.funFact: The original M&M‚Äôs came only in red, yellow, green, brown, and violet‚Äîbut violet was later replaced with tan in 1949!
